text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 7.11.10, Employee Plans Determination Letter Program, EP Examination and Fraud Referral Procedures.
Updated IRM 7.11.10.2 and IRM 7.11.10.2.2 for Rev. Proc. 2021-30 .
This supersedes IRM 7.11.10 dated June 3,
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Employee Plans
Table of Contents
Examination and Fraud Referral Procedures 7.11.10

Program Goals: The goal of EP Determinations is to ensure that plans with the tax laws by reviewing applications for determination letters, opinion letters and advisory letters, and to protect the public interest by applying the tax law with integrity and fairness to all.
A plan is qualiﬁed if it meets the requirements of IRC 401(a) in form and operation. A qualiﬁed plan is entitled to favorable tax treatment.

) Tax fraud is often deﬁned as an intentional wrongdoing on the part of a taxpayer, with the speciﬁc purpose of evading a tax known or believed to be Overview owed. Tax fraud requires both: a. A tax due and owing. b. A fraudulent intent. (

) Taxpayers who knowingly understate their tax liability often leave evidence the form of indicators. Fraud indicators are divided into two categories: a. Indications of Fraud are a sign or symptom, or signify that actions have been taken for the purpose of deceit, concealment or to make things seem other than what they are. b. Affirmative Acts (Firm Indications) of Fraud are those actions that establish that a particular process was deliberately done for the of deceit, subterfuge, camouﬂage, concealment, some attempt to color obscure events, or make things seem other than what they are.
Exception: You don’t need to keep a copy of Form 5666 for referrals that involve taxability of distributions to beneﬁciaries upon termination.

) Tax fraud is often deﬁned as an intentional wrongdoing on the part of a taxpayer, with the speciﬁc purpose of evading a tax known or believed to owed. Tax fraud requires both: a. A tax due and owing. b. A fraudulent intent. (

) Taxpayers who knowingly understate their tax liability often leave the form of indicators. Fraud indicators are divided into two categories: a. Indications of Fraud are a sign or symptom, or signify that actions have been taken for the purpose of deceit, concealment or to make things seem other than what they are. b. Affirmative Acts (Firm Indications) of Fraud are those actions establish that a particular process was deliberately done for the of deceit, subterfuge, camouﬂage, concealment, some attempt to obscure events, or make things seem other than what they are.
Taxpayers who knowingly understate their tax liability often leave evidence in the form of indicators. Fraud indicators are divided into two categories:

Indications of Fraud are a sign or symptom, or signify that actions may have been taken for the purpose of deceit, concealment or to make things seem other than what they are. Affirmative Acts (Firm Indications) of Fraud are those actions that establish that a particular process was deliberately done for the purpose of deceit, subterfuge, camouﬂage, concealment, some attempt to color or obscure events, or make things seem other than what they are.

) If you identify an affirmative act of fraud: a. Immediately suspend all case activity. b. Notify your manager. (

) If your manager agrees, contact the EPDFR. The EPDFR arranges a ence call with the EP SME, FTA, EPDFR, EP Determinations specialist and Determinations manager to discuss the case. If the FTA agrees that an tive act has been identiﬁed, make a criminal fraud referral to CID using

) If the criminal fraud referral is approved, the FTA manager secure emails Form
to the appropriate CID Field Office for consideration. (
) A CID supervisory special agent is assigned to evaluate the criminal fraud referral and arranges two disposition conferences. The ﬁrst conference is within
days of receiving the criminal fraud referral to discuss the merits the case and the second within

days to discuss whether the criminal referral is accepted or declined. The following individuals are invited to the conferences: • EP Determinations specialist • EP Determinations manager • FTA • Supervisory special agent • Special agent Note: The EP Determinations specialist and manager should invite the EPDFR the EP SME to attend these conferences.
